text: Aatha Naan Pass Ayittaen () is a 1990 Tamil language drama film produced and directed by M. K. Saimohan. The film features Arjun, Shantipriya and Malashri in the lead roles. The film a had musical score by Vidyasagar and was released on 23 November 1990.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4016MbqYGKw ==Cast== *Arjun as Chinnasamy *Shantipriya *Malashri *Gandhimathi *Anuja *S. R. Vijaya *Senthil *Venniradai Moorthy *Jaiganesh *K. Kannan *Usilaimani *Kullamani *Sharjah Sheriff *Satishkumar *Venky *Jacky Siva ==Soundtrack== The film score and the soundtrack were composed by film composer Vidyasagar. The soundtrack, released in 1990, features 5 tracks.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ahAkMcSsm8Q {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:95%;" ! Track !! Song !! Singer(s)!! Duration |- |1 || 'Kanaavil Partha' || || 3:25 |- |2 || 'Nethu Varaikum' || || |- |3 || 'Onna Renda Ava' || || |- |4 || 'Ponga Vachi' || || |- |5 || 'Moonu Mozha' || || |} ==Release== Aatha Naan Pass Aayitten was released on 23 November 1990 alongside another Arjun starrer Thangaikku Oru Thalattu.https://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movies/slideshow/list-of-top-tamil- heroes-who-had-two-releases-on-the-same-date/arjun.html ==References== Category:1990 films Category:Indian films Category:1990s Tamil-language films Category:Indian drama films Category:Tamil films scored by Vidyasagar Category:1990 drama films
title: Aatha Naan Pass Ayittaen
